column4: OK, here'smy problem I have an SD Card, it was working fine minutes ago... now, it decided that it wouldn't automount it, tried gparting it to a fat32 and it said "set partitiontype" tried using the command unmount which doesn't seem to exist on my system... and now I have an SD Card that I can't use... What do I do?
Does anybody know how to reformat a stubborn, unformatted disk?
I tried gparting it, but it keeps coming up with the error "set partitiontype"...
OK...
It also won't let me delete the old partition which is unknown.
It won't let me creat a new partition and it won't let me delete the old one.
OK, this sucks.... I can't even get gparted to delete a partition...
It sees it, but it won't let me do anything to it.
No, just want it to be a fat32 storage device.
are you using gparted?
what kind of drive? USB? IDE?
what does it show up as in /dev ??
gparted should take care of it. Did you umount it?
sudo umount /media/cardname
cardname is whatever the name of the disk is in /media
it's not in /media?
yeah
it's Umount, not UNmount
it shouldnt automount, as it's not a USB device
only USB devices automoutn when hotplugged
did you change any options pertaining to hotplugging?
